Description: Body sherd from shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery oinochoe; interior reserved with wheelmarks; exterior, buff slip: zone of meander and squares at top above wide band with added red (and white?); below, part of a griffin to right; filling ornaments: roughly drawn rosette and blob; added red paint on wing, leg and eye of griffin.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 49)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.627)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
